newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indorama plans stock split, bonus issue.
newsitem.headline: Indorama plans stock split, bonus issue.

text.p: Indonesia's PT Indorama Synthetics plans a bonus issue and a stock split to increase the amount of floating stock in the market, a senior company official said.

The company plans a four-for-five bonus issue and, in addition, will double the number of shares in the market by reducing nominal value to 500 rupiah from the existing 1,000 rupiah, company official Vishnu Baldwa said.
The two moves will increase the amount of stock in the market to 655 million shares from the existing 182 million, Baldwa said.
"This will increase floating stock and add to the share's liquidity," he told Reuters.
The planned moves will be put before shareholders at a meeting on October 8 for approval, he said.
Indorama closed at 6,625 rupiah on the Jakarta Stock Exchange on Friday and was unchanged in early trade on Monday.
